content.description:
An epic adventure that will test your 5.10 climbing skills, lead head, and rope length all in one mega-pitch. This route is a MUST DO for anyone who is solid at hard 5.10, low 5.11 climbing. Long, technical, and loaded with mid to hard 5.10 cruxes, this route just keeps coming at you.  
  
 Located in the Corridor at the Fortress, this route starts under a black water streaked roof system by a big tree. It stays left of the corner, heading up through the black streak, then stays left of the obvious anchor out right (you'll want to clip this with a long runner, and you do rappel off of it), then heads left up to a high bolt, and romps up through extremely technical terrain straight to the top of the wall and a good belay ledge. Two rappels are required to get back down, unless you trail a line. This route is not to be missed, easily one of the best climbs in the area.

In The Corridor at The Fortress, just right of a huge tree, left of a small corner. The obvious black streak through a low roof.
14 bolts, anchor kit, one or two long runners.

A cam or two will protect the first move to overcome the roof.

4 bolts + 1 or 2 cams, bolted anchor.

Equally good as Primal Dream, this one begins beside the big tree. Move up the corner and bulge to the ledge left of the tree. Continue up the steep wall above to the hanging belay. Second pitch steps right to follow a thin crack. No fixed anchors on top. 
  
 P1: 5.10a (30m)  
 P2: 5.10b/c (25m)

Begin at the big tree right of Primal Dream. Joins that route at the top.
Gear. Take some small to medium CDs and wires for the top.

First pitch only*. The route starts with thin moves to take you past the first couple bolts, followed by fun climbing on some of the biggest jugs I've seen at the fortress. At the roof, place a piece of gear and make a interesting move to get into the right facing corner. Follow this corner a short ways, clip another bolt, and make a airy step right to deke around another roof. The anchor is another 15 feet of easy climbing up.

The line of bolts following the biggest holds on that section of the wall. 20 feet to the right of the three smaller Douglas Firs.
9 bolts, plus a couple pieces of gear needed for the corner/roof section. Route is 31m so tie rope ends!

climbs.name: Stillborn
climbs.fa: P1: Robin Barley, Brian Balazs-2002/ P2: Ward Jensen- 2016

content.description:
Find an easy way to the first bolt and climb small holds to the second (crux). Then climb over a small roof feature onto the wall above, ending at a ledge at upper Fortress,5.10c. The second pitch continues from here, 5.9

Stillborn starts just right if the big for tree and beside a bush under a blank looking slab. This climb is listed in the “Corridor” section of the new book. #55
P1- 10 bolts, P2- 9 bolts. Chain anchors With rap rings.
A collection of quality long routes, several of which are mixed and two pitches in length. Mostly 10s but a couple 11s as well.
